content: @Lloyd McKenzie the davinca-crd guide, like others, has warnings like this:
The extension http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/igpublisher-spreadsheet is unknown, and not allowed here
The template adds this extension, but it's not currently valid.

what's the intention here?

  • the template shouldn't define it
  • the IG publisher should get rid of it
  • we should define the extension somehow
The template needs to define it, as the publisher uses it to load data from the spreadsheets. Whether we want the publisher to then strip it or keep it and be happy with it, I'm fine either way.
I don't see where the publisher uses it anywhere
How does it know what spreadsheets to load?

The template looks for them. The Publisher needed to be told about them - at least it used to. And doing a scan is a configuration option, it shouldn't be automatic. (Sometimes the author will list the spreadsheets explicitly and not want ones not referenced to be built - SDC used to behave that way.)
I can't see anywhere that the IG publisher does anything about that extension
Then it's changed - because it used to be driven by that extension
well, ok, I eventually chased it down. Several levels of redirection... Anyway, I'm going to delete that extension now
